verbs.description: relume (third-person singular simple present relumes, present participle reluming, simple past and past participle relumed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, now rare) To rekindle; to relight (literally or figuratively). [from 17th c.]
examples: Aʀᴀᴛᴜs, who a while relum'd the Soul / Of fondly lingering Liberty in Gʀᴇᴇᴄᴇ  […] .

entries.meaning: (transitive, now rare) To make clear or bright again. [from 18th c.]
